comments.commentBody:
We need three things:

Tax returns

Tax returns

Tax returns
My question that hasn't been answered in all this: What was the Russian ambassador doing at the Republican convention anyway?

I don't care what he was doing. His mere presence there was a pox on the democratic process and a stain on the Republican Party that won't soon come out. A national political convention is no place for foreign agents.

The pendulum has swung backwards. The former rabidly anti-communist party of Senator Joe McCarthy (after he was a Democrat) has now become the unapologetic (except for the lying) Russophile Party.

"Nothing to see here, folks. Move along!"

Except that there is plenty to see, and to smell. It stinks to high heaven, and the self-described "swamp-drainer in chief" Trumpy the Swamp Thing has refilled it with populist Russophiles who see nothing wrong with conspiring and colluding with the enemy as long as the ends can justify those means.

How many Americans know about the American ("Know Nothing") Party? That's the historical dustbin into which the current Republican Party will hopefully find itself in a few election cycles, replaced by something less Russophile and more republican.

@Michjas, Sessions is more than tainted beyond repair, he committed the crime of perjury, thus needs to be prosecuted.
Couple of minor corrections needed here:
1) Sessions lied to congress (no ambiguity here)
2) There was criminal intent (no negligence here)

If the United States were a long-time TV show, casting Jeff Sessions as head of Justice would be the "jumping the shark" episode.

For whose record screams "Justice!" less than that of Mr. Sessions? Oh sure, whose record screams "HUD!" less than Dr. Carson's, and whose record screams, "And the other one whose name I can't remember!" less than Gov. Perry's?

For a man with reprehensible views, we are assured, Jeff Sessions is puckishly good-natured.

I suppose Tojo could make children smile too.

This is really happening. All of it. We are stunned by the utter din and klieg lights. Many of our fellow Americans actually voted for this Cirque de Hades of xenophobia and Caucasian revenge, this mountebank who has improvised from the campaign and now from the White House.

Now is the time for the Fourth Estate to prove its worth. In the face of the GOP intransigence that has shifted from Obama to the New York Times, journalists must persevere, even as those who most desperately need to read the truth reach Level 88 of Candy Crush.

Yes, Gail. You and your colleagues might be shouting for all you're worth just outside the echo chamber where millions have retreated, shielded from the ambiguities and absurdities of the real world where their role is so much less rewarding than they were led to believe it would be.

That echo chamber numbs and soothes, affixes all blame on others, and provides absolution from vicious words and thoughts.

Journalists: Do your jobs. Shout louder. Please.
Kudos for writing the best comment of the day.
Racist has to go. With the evidence piling up there can only be conclusion, collusion.
Of course it does, the trouble is, it looked that way for many months, and we elected the jerk president anyway.

"Maybe Trump can unleash the guys who spent all those years "investigating" the Obama birther claims and Vince Foster murder conspiracies. They should have some free time now to look into this."

I don't know. They may well still be working on that.

Required viewing for Sessions so he won't be "confused": SNL. No dissembling there, they call a farce a farce. Likewise so must we. The whole Trump shebang is farce.
Fourth option for Sessions: Fedex him to Russia, c.o.d.

The phrase "further erodes our ability to work together..." is very interesting. Did the meeting in a D.C. steakhouse on Jan. 20, 2009 by the Republican leaders that resulted in a strategy to not cooperate or "work together" with President Obama at all "erode our ability to work together?" The Republicans in Congress knew they could get away with this strategy because they knew that it wouldn't hurt their standing with their somewhat racist base. After all, Obama was and is black.

I am baffled by the double standards here. Does anyone think that if the shoe was on the democrat's foot that the roof would not be rising so far off of the House of Representatives that the escaping roar would deafen us and make our knees tremble. Nancy Pelosi, please, put your best dogs on it Come on Senator Franken lets save our democracy. Don't let this exhaust us before action is taken.

Mike, I, too, wondered about that!

Don't you find it ironic that so many Republicans, those stalwart opponents of the Red Menace only a generation ago, suddenly seem so "comfortable" with the unfolding saga of revelations of multiple contacts -- in Cleveland and elsewhere -- with the regime of that wolf in sheep's clothing, Vladimir Putin?

Sessions looks like an aged version of Alfred E Neuman and oozes high-pitched Southern charm, but he's as mean as a snake.

It boggles the mind that so many of our top government officials can look you in the eye and lie with a straight face, even after they've been caught multiple times, but it seems to be a talent that is developed through a lot of practice. And it's a habit that will never be broken.

My dream of Sessions' future is a prison cell in his native Alabama. Let him see how his victims live.
I hear they're renaming it Clevelandstan right after they replace Obamacare with something much, much better and beautiful, really beautiful.

Mr. Sessions has built a career on being a loyal and "charming little pixie." He's not alone. Many of our national figures seem small and would likely be inconsequential were they unable to wield the powers of their positions. One wants to believe that this phenomenon, made plain in the Trump era, is akin to the final bright dying embers of a scorched earth political fire. The Sessions-like saplings shouldn't survive. Our political forest is ready for new growth, for real leaders and for statesmen confident of their vision and possessed of individuality and integrity, who will stand tall and firm. Only voters who value these characteristics and participate in fair and free elections can accomplish this reseeding.

Cowbells, goats, sand castles, burning or collapsing house parts--no wonder so many people are confused. Maybe health care is not so metaphorical. Maybe it is a basic need for human dignity, and personal and societal development.

The Republicans are consistently energized to cut benefits for those less fortunate, to make life better for those already better off. They want to devolve medical coverage to the states. Just a lot of bad ideas, whatever metaphors might surface.

Maybe less punitive elements of their party will hold sway and we'll get thoughtful repair more than partisan assertions. We need balance and repair, not party platforms and partisan theater.

Sessions answered Frankens question by stating that as a part of the Trump election team, he did not speak with Russian operatives.  Simple, clear.  However I am certain that he was secretly conspiring with Russian spies to over throw the U.S. governnment so that Putin could rule the world.  It could not have been anything else.
He did not qualify his statement that way. He said he himself had been called a surrogate for Trump and he had not met with the Russians. PERIOD.

The Republican Party is doing more harm to the United States than any foreign terrorist organization ever has. The media is finally calling the GOP's lies what they are, lies. Now it's time to use the word treason. Wake up America!

The Bowling Green Massacre. The Strange Incident with Mem Fox. And now--the Cleveland Cabal.

A Series of Unfortunate Events?

Jeff Sessions harbors ideas that were relevant in the South prior to the Civil war.  That is a worldview we could do without.  As far as his perjurying himself during the senate hearing for his confirmation: why would he do that?  Did he actually think the truth would never come out or is he taking on the Tweeter-in-Chief's M.O. lying as way of being?

If the US had more than two major political parities, you wouldn't have half the headaches. This polarization is destroying your country. Seriously, you cannot find any middle ground anywhere?

What you need is a third, or forth, party to step in alongside the democrats – and every other logical person in the world – to say, "yes, something certainly seems fishy here and we should have some an outside organization fully investigate".

With backing from multiple parties, such an investigation would either clear the air for Trump's team or send them all packing, depending on the results. Without any additional political parties with heft, America is doomed to
he-said-she-said politics forever – to the detriment of your nation.

It's all so tiring.

If Hillary's use of a private email server and her well-compensated speeches before Wall Street bankers raised a whiff of impropriety, then Trump's cronies' multitudinous meetings with Russians raise a pungent stink that is clouding our land and wafting to high heaven. While there is no smoking gun as of yet, there is smoke aplenty regardless. And speaking of rot, it is well known that the fish rots from the head. And here the head is DJT, a serial and chronic liar. His reassurances and denials are as fake as the journalism he decries is truth-seeking.
If William Shakespeare were alive today, he would have to update the geographical reference of his famous 'Something is rotten in the state of Denmark'. The bard would know that something very foul has been picked up in the air of our very troubled democracy. It is choking us.

We could have used Trump during the cold war. I just can't believe how popular Russia is with folks in Alabama and Kansas these days. Evangelicals and family values voters getting all warm and fuzzy with Putin. Let's extend a friendly hand across the sea, from Washington to Moscow, Never mind those European countries standing between us - they'll soon be brought back into the orbit. It'll be deja vu all over again for Hungary and Latvia and Poland - and this time the USA will be on board!

Seb.  I'm as liberal as they come but let's face it.  Most of our fellow Democrats won't show up in 2018.  Easier to just blow the responsibility of voting off and just complain and whinge.  Get used to eight more years of this nonsense.

There are 33 places in the world named Cleveland. Chosen for his shrewdness Jeffsky never specifically mentioned which one he was referring to.

There is one near Darby England @ this location. 54°28'60.0"N 0°55'00.0"W. Travel time from Russia is 6 hours and 35 minutes by plane and 9 hours 39 minutes from NYC by plane. It appears that the Russians got us on this one.

There was also, no Cleveland in Siberia. Perhaps, his bigotry not withstanding, Sessions might try to use this as a reason against his "I'm a Russian at Heart " investigation?

The answers lie in Trump's still unrevealed taxes. To whom does the Trump Organization owe money? Who has been financing their projects? Way back in 2008, Don, Jr. was bragging about how much Ru$$ian money was coming into their US projects.
The bigger issue is going to be when Deutsche Bank blows up. It was the last bank with a US presence to finance Trump (six bankruptcies, you know, only five or six worth of forebearance than you or I would have gotten from the banks). Deutsche is on the precipice of being identified as an accessory to the Bank of Cyprus in laundering money for Ru$$ian oligarchs and mobsters.
Those are the real bad dudes afoot, and we have the right to know if our president is owned by them. What was it again Nixon said about knowing whether or not our president is a crook? Like Nixon said in his second campaign, where he couldn't resist cheating on a layup, "now more than ever."
